column4: hello, I am trying to install the k7 kernel using the command line in edgy, I am doing it the same way I always have in other versions but its not showing up in grub, any idea's anyone?
well would the 686 kermnel be better for me than the 386 one with althonxp 2600+?
there is no k7 kernel. generic kernel has taken over all the functionality of the special kernels. also; #ubuntu+1
